title: 113_s1268
content: Approval of the agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau. The curr_chunk defines "Agreement" and "Compact of Free Association" and discusses the results of the Compact Review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with the exception of the extension of article X regarding Federal Programs and Services. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with the exception of the extension of article X. If Palau withdraws more than $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011-2013, certain amounts payable under the Agreement will be withheld. The Agreement signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 is approved, with the exception of the extension of article X. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011-2013, certain payments under the Agreement will be withheld until the excess amount is reimbursed. Additionally, funding for specific provisions under Section 105 of the Compact of Free Association will be transferred from the Treasury to the Secretary of the Interior within 30 days of this section's enactment. Within 30 days of enactment, funds will be transferred from the Treasury to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing certain provisions of the Agreement. Appropriations are authorized for subsidizing postal services provided by the United States Postal Service. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to appropriate $1,500,000 annually for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia until 2024. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to appropriate funds for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia until 2024. Additionally, funds are allocated to Federal entities for carrying out responsibilities under the Compact of Free Association. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to appropriate funds for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia until 2024. Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 is repealed. The Agreement's Compact section 211(f) fund payment schedule and funding are outlined. The Compact section 211(f) fund payment schedule and funding are outlined. The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund according to a specified schedule from fiscal year 2014 to 2023. Additionally, there will be a grant for infrastructure maintenance provided by the Government of the United States. The Government of the United States will provide $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 for an Infrastructure Maintenance Fund in Palau. The Government of the Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund by providing $150,000 quarterly from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. The Government of the Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund by providing $150,000 quarterly from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. SEC. 3. FISCAL CONSOLIDATION FUND. The United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. This is in addition to the economic assistance provided in previous years. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. The United States will provide Palau with $69,250,000 in economic assistance over the fiscal years 2014 to 2019, with varying amounts allocated each year. The United States will provide Palau with decreasing economic assistance over fiscal years 2015 to 2023, starting at $11,500,000 in 2015 and decreasing to $2,000,000 in 2023. The funds will be provided in 4 quarterly payments each year. The economic assistance provided in fiscal years will be given in 4 quarterly payments, with varying percentages each quarter. Infrastructure projects will be governed by specific terms outlined in the Agreement. "Infrastructure projects will be governed by specific terms outlined in the Agreement." The Government of the United States will provide grants totaling $40,000,000 to Palau for infrastructure projects. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 is amended to extend programs until 2024. Passport requirements under the Compact of Free Association are clarified. Passport requirements under the Compact of Free Association are clarified. Passport requirements under the Compact of Free Association allow certain individuals to reside in the US without specific restrictions from the Immigration and Nationality Act. Passport requirements under the Compact of Free Association allow individuals from the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands, citizens of Palau, and naturalized citizens of Palau to have a machine-readable passport. Citizens of Palau, whether by birth or naturalization, are permitted to accept employment in the United States with the approval of the Secretary of Homeland Security. They may also establish habitual residence in a U.S. territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations. The Secretary of Homeland Security of the United States can approve citizens of Palau to work in the U.S. and establish residence in a U.S. territory, with non-discriminatory limitations. This does not grant them the right to naturalization or petition for alien benefits under the Immigration and Nationality Act. The Secretary of Homeland Security can approve citizens of Palau to work and establish residence in a U.S. territory, with non-discriminatory limitations. However, this does not grant them the right to naturalization or petition for alien benefits under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
